metadata.Title: CVE-2021-31525 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
net/http in Go before 1.15.12 and 1.16.x before 1.16.4 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (panic) via a large header to ReadRequest or ReadResponse. Server, Transport, and Client can each be affected in some configurations.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-31525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-golang-x-net-dev - 1:0.0+git20220728.c7608f3+dfsg-2
No subscription required

google-guest-agent - 20220622.00-0ubuntu2~22.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: alexmurray> google-guest-agent contains a vendored copy of golang-golang-x-net

criterions.comment: golang-golang-x-net package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:0.0+git20220728.c7608f3+dfsg-2').
google-guest-agent package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20220622.00-0ubuntu2~22.04.1').
